pros:
- Amazing mission to be part of. Everyone is contributing in some way to providing immediate help and relief to hurting people around the world. The work being done is very rewarding.
- New hires are given a good introduction to all aspects of what Samaritan's Purse does, and how your role and department fits into that bigger puzzle of being the hands and feet of Jesus.
- Really enjoyed working with the people here. Just about everyone is fantastic.
- Morning devotions were a great way to start the day, ensuring our minds were focused on Christ before we dove into that day's work.
- Prayer is encouraged, either individually or in a more team setting.
- Healthcare provided on site which was really surprising and appreciated.
- Cafeteria food was surprisingly really great and a good price.
- Boone is a beautiful location. The mountain summers were pleasant and the fall was gorgeous. If you like small town living, Boone and the surrounding area is a nice place to live. I grew up in the city but learned to appreciate small town living.
cons:
- Inconsistent resistance to working remotely, which I didn't understand, especially in an age of COVID quarantines and such. 
-Not a lot of ability to promote up. Career planning felt like mostly waiting for someone above you to leave, which could take years if they're well established. Or months if they decide to leave since turnover seemed kind of high.
- Location leaves something to be desired. Boone is a beautiful mountain town but the real estate is ridiculously expensive. You'll end up paying a lot to live close by or end up commuting 30-40 min. to pay a more reasonable rent/mortgage. 
- If you're more of a city person, there's not a lot going on in Boone. The next "big" town is Hickory which is about an hour away and has some decent amenities. Charlotte is 2 hours away which is where the closest international airport is. 
- Samaritan's Purse is one of the main employers in town so you'll frequently run into coworkers at church, coffee shops, etc. Could be bad or good, depending on your preference.
- Seems like the kind of place that is best for fresh college grads, single adults, and those who've already had a full career. Not the best for families with young kids where one parent is working.
- For such a large organization, it felt like it was still run with the mentality of a family owned business. That's fine in some respects, as you do feel close knit but I don't think it's the right management style for an organization this large.

pros: They have alot of internal funds which can be used to make impact around the world.
cons: 1) SP pays very little compared to other organization. This causes huge staff turnover which doesnt help the organization. 2) Some of the internal projects have very little money which do not make sense or have any impact especially giveb the huge internal funds.

review_title: This is solely a humanitarian organization
pros: The benefits are excellent. I got to see the brand new Tesla that just sits in the fleet garage. The lunches are cheap and incredible. I got to meet the people of Yemen, some of the finest people I can hope to ever know.
cons: This organization is essentially the UN. If you feel like you want to work for a religious organization, this place is spiritually bankrupt. They pay the local guards and drivers in Yemen $350/month to work 8 hours a day, 6 days a week. They give the expat staff $300 cash each month just for food. If you hope to be able to talk with your Yemeni friends about anything, they explicitly tell you not to. So you aren’t allowed to talk about your own religious life, and you aren’t helping the poor of yemen. If you are a deist, this organization is great! If you’re an evangelical Christian, this place is an impediment to the Gospel.

review_title: Great way to merge secular job knowledge with Kingdom/Mission work.
pros:
Samaritan's Purse is an international relief organization with evangelism at its core.  It's great to work and know that you're making a difference in spreading the gospel of the Lord Jesus Christ to the nations as well as meeting their physical needs.  Everyone here is working toward the same goal to help those devastated by natural disasters, famine, war, disease, and poverty.

International Headquarters is located in the Appalachian Mountains next to the Blue Ridge Parkway.  It's a blessing to see the surrounding countryside every day.  There are many hiking trails, ski slopes, mountain lakes, and other natural wonders within a short distance.

The internal work environment is as good as the external.  Offices are nice and the housekeeping and facilities staff keep everything in tip-top shape.  Employees have the opportunity to eat in the employee dining room for lunch for a reasonable fee.

Salary is competitive as far as non-profits go.  The benefit package with insurance, paid leave, and retirement plan is competitive with the corporate world.
cons:
Boone, NC is a resort town, so housing can be expensive.  However, less expensive options are within a 30-minute commute.

Salary may be a little low, but the job satisfaction in knowing you're doing eternal/social good makes up for it.

Western North Carolina weather can be a little extreme in the winter compared to some areas.  The pleasant summers help balance it.

review_title: Great environment for some, terrible for others
pros: Their project managers and field staff are amazing.
cons: Their senior leadership is sexist, ageist, and racist. If you're not a middle-aged white male, watch out.

pros: Very encouraging environment in terms of your relationship with Christ. Excellent workplace for mature Christians. Fair pay. Excellent benefits. The people you work with are always kind and considerate.
cons: The changes being made to Samaritan's Purse make the work we do more difficult. In the end it works out because we make it work. Something people applying for positions should consider that wasn't always a focus of our organization is that Samaritan's Purse is unwilling to hire people who agree in any way with same sex marriage or anyone who believes life starts at any point past conception. People who are neutral to these positions are also not hirable.  This is not a job that encourages diversity. If you think outside of the box, you won't be a good fit, and SP is very quick to cut off what they believe to be dead wood. As a Christian organization, all they need is one bible verse to back up any decision they make. it's important to them that everyone has the same perspective on everything. This is an ideal job for radical conservatives who are also devout Christians. They are very unlikely to knowingly hire a liberal

review_title: Improvement Needed: Open Communication and Empowering Employees
pros: Christ centered and stand firm to their mission of helping those in need worldwide in Jesus' Name; Health benefits.
cons: Strong organizational hierarchy; little to no upwards growth opportunities; slow to change.

review_title: The reality is very different than the perception
pros: Many of the people who do the work at Samaritan's Purse are wonderful, talented, caring, and sincere. Benefits are generous.
cons:
Despite many good people working throughout the organization, senior leadership tends to be ineffective at best, at worst erratic and irrational. The atmosphere is akin to a typical cutthroat corporate environment with a layer of Christian manipulation on top. Fear and control are motivators for middle managers who discourage innovation for fear of rocking the boat. For this reason, many employees are working far below their skill levels. 

Promotions and raises are sometimes determined by the employee's political views, age, or gender, as the CEO is a staunch Christian right warrior. Employees are required to work excessive hours and fulfill duties outside their job descriptions without title or compensation. The organization delves deeply into employees' personal lives, examining church attendance, marital status, and social lives.

Many employees and former employees are afraid to speak out, fearing church and social exile in this small mountain town. The feeling of "making a difference" at the outset can quickly turn to survival in the crossfires of the executives jockeying for power.

review_title: Great Place to Work with Purpose!

job_title: Cash Program Administrative in Athens, Athens, Attica

pros: My coworkers have become my friends and together we have impacted thousands of people in some of the most difficult places in the world. It is truly satisfying work.
cons:
This is the most bureaucratic organization I have ever experienced in my life. Essentially the top management of the organization make every decision- including who will get business cards or not! 

Women are frequently discriminated against and not promoted to any management job at IHQ or in the field. Making lower-level women wonder if the leaders of the organization value them and also question what their job outlook is like with the organization. SP is a boys club. 

The benefits and pay are horrible and everyone feels overworked, underpaid, and nearly burnt out.

pros: Christian beliefs and praying together
cons: Low salary not matching with market

review_title: Great place to work with excellent leadership and career opportunities
pros: Samaritan's Purse has a very clear vision to be Christ's hands, feet, and heart to a world in need.  To be a part of this is very exhilarating.  The leadership is very solid in IT and the feeling of comradery and shared mission makes coming to work a joy.  There is a lot of young talent in the department.  This young group is willing to collaborate and share their knowledge while also being open to new technologies and directions.  The facilities are bar none some of the best I have worked in (and I have worked at Microsoft).  Being a part of Samaritan’s Purse in “such a time as this” is very exciting and weighty (in a very good way).
cons: The only con I can think of is being in Boone (I don't see this as a con), but some might find it hard to deal with the weather or climate depending on where you come from.

pros: SP gets lots of money from a private donor base which allows a lot of flexibility in responding to disasters - responses can be set up quickly.  SP can be very good at this.
cons: Micromanagement from IHQ is rampant - VPs and Regional Directors trampling all over those at the country level.  The organization is run essentially like Franklin Graham's personal fiefdom, with tinges of a good ol' boys club.  Pay isn't great, and pay scale isn't transparent.  Multiple individuals in the same position have different salary levels regardless of similarity in experience and tenure with the organization.

review_title: Need more work/life balance for Field Staff
pros: Field Staff hired are EXCELLENT!! Incredibly skilled and godly people. The mission draws them -
cons: HQ needs to listen to the Field more. Too much burn-out and too much aggrandizing of Franklin. He is just a broken human like everyone else.  Take down all the Franklin pictures all over campus - put up instead more pics of those you've helped.

review_title: You really need to be a true Good Samaritan to work here
pros: Overall purpose and mission of company is great since it fulfills the Great Commission to go and tell the world of God's GREAT love - and helping others in less fortunate or desperate circumstances
cons: Takes a toll on your personal life because you are always responding and working in the saddest, most devestating situations and staff expend themselves far beyond the call of duty to make things happen.  Expectations are placed on staff to volunteer for various events and functions.  Management unfortunately demonstrates favouritism and scrutinizes staff on unrealistic criteria for advancement

review_title: Want a job? Who do you know?
pros: Working with an amazing team of passionate people who live in the 'real' world and know what it is to do the hard yards. People who are loving, caring, supportive and are doing everything to extend the reach of the ministry without the 'politics' practiced by those higher up the food chain.
cons: Ego driven middle management. Middle management that haven't a clue how to work with people that are 'below' them. Narcissist behaviours that are not "seen" (ignored) by the senior manager.   Company is run 'with jobs for the boys' mentality. Employment is not based on experience but personality and 'who you know".  If you are over 35 years old don't bother applying for jobs as State/Regional Managers as you are considered 'too old" for the image that they want to portray. No where to go if there is an issue as Senior Manager/Board won't/don't listen or 'hear' what is being said.

pros: Throughout my hire process, everyone in the company went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable and cared about. With dozens of people involved in the hiring process, this effort was seamless to the point that I didn't even realize just how much of a well-oiled machine the inner workings of Samaritan's Purse is. Now as a full-time staff, I can see first-hand that the hiring process isn't the only thing that functions exceptionally--every department is run with a unique combination of strict attention to detail and intentionality. They certainly run by the "work for God, not for man" mentality.
cons: Though this is a 24/7 functioning business, I think it would be great for tours to the facility to include a look into the day-to-day operations. While people come to tour the place behind the purpose of Samaritan's Purse, it would bring about a completely new level of respect seeing just how the nitty gritty runs.

pros: The pay is decent and field offices have tights knit staffs. It's an environment of hard working people with sincere faith. Daily devotions with staff is a unique component to this aid agency. Time off varies depending on the posting, CD and nature of your project.
cons: The majority of management is white males in a top-down org structure. Women do not get promoted in the field beyond Deputy Country Director. Internationals faring slightly better with one CD who is not Western or white. The board of directors does not have people of different races, but does have one woman with the title "Executive Secretary". Lack of emphasis on M&E or evidenced based approach. Personality driven by a couple top positions.

review_title: Very fulfilling work. You get to be a part of a team to help others around the world.
pros: The people you work with are very nice and understanding. The work is very meaningful and you have many opportunities to get involved in volunteer work.
cons: Very conservative organization. Strict rules and spiritual pressure to conform to a certain standard of spiritual life. The organization is run from the top down, almost like a dictatorship style of leadership. Not as much collaborative process because what the president says goes no matter how creative you might be or no matter how amazing your ideas are.

review_title: Great colleagues and support, questionable humanitarian practices
pros:
-Strongly committed to Evangelical Christian beliefs and ethics
-Generally kind and supportive staff and mentors at all levels
-Ample opportunity for advancement
cons:
-Can be promoted to positions that you are not qualified or adequately trained to take
-Strong disconnect between culture of HQ and most country offices
-Very tight financial and procurement policies that can hamper field agility and response times
-Leadership is generally homogeneous in demographics and approach to work
-Very arduous working hours and conditions can be given in field with RR schedules and compensation that is well below industry standards, even for faith based NGOs.
-Considered lone rangers among humanitarian implementers (often for valid reasons)

review_title: Great organization if you truly evangelical.
pros: Samaritan's Purse is very generous to their field staff  in terms of compensation, and are working in some of the most difficult places, thus truly living out their mission and vision statements.
cons: Unlike many other christian non government organizations, Samaritan's Purse does not have a furlow program for their long term staff--meaning that you need to resign your position to catch your breath rather than just taking a break.

pros: Most everyone here is unarguably full of great intentions and genuine love for their coworkers and the work SP does around the world.
cons:
1) Witnessed Operation Christmas Child statistics being knowingly falsified for the sake of protecting it's reputation
2) Witnessed Operation Christmas Child report that volunteer abuses were resolved, when in reality they weren't
3) Witnessed management repeatedly force their own will on subordinates without listening to reason or engaging dialogue around complex topics.
4) Management has no avenue for receiving feedback from employees. Speaking out against a supervisor is a fireable offense.
5) Some employees get paid far too well, while others get the other end of the stick.

pros: It is a fun and exciting environment where you can see where your works goes.  It is amazing to see the impact of your work as it is seen on the faces of children and adults through the disaster relief efforts and OCC.
cons: Too many big personalities and no one reins them in.  Every executive feels that their area is the most important and no one seems willing to budge.  In some areas managers aren't allowed to manage or make management decisions.

pros: World class professionals, within their own career fields, that are sold out for Christ!  Able to share your faith while providing help to those that are hurting or in need.  Love how quickly we respond to crisis situations around the globe.
cons: People are extremely passionate about their work, which is a good thing, but can lead to some work/life balance challenges.

pros: Unwavering focus on a fulfilling organizational mission.
cons: No advancement opportunities if entering as Administrative Assistant.  Shamed if prioritize family over the mission. Senior management too overwhelmed by pressure to meet leadership's high expectations to sufficiently fulfill desire to invest in the professional development of employees who report to them.

review_title: working as a translator for Arabic and English
pros: i was working as a volunteer translator in a organtion called euro rilief in greece lesbos island. i had had meet allot of people with me from samaritan's puse they were helping my organtion that i was working with in cothes and allot of things most of them become my friends . i saw the samaritan's puse needed an Arabic translator and i had finished my time with my organtion and i was ready to work with them and help them . i can speak Arabic and english both 100% and i saw samaritan's purse as a good organtion with a good cuse to help refugees in greece
cons: For the things that i saw in samaritans's purs i didn't see downsides .

job_title: Temporary Mail and Data Processing Associate in Boone, NC
pros: Great work environment, it is a very pleasant place to be and they make sure to keep you updated on all of the projects that Samaritan's Purse is working on so you really feel involved in the organization.  Everybody there really seems to care about what they are doing and you never dread going to work or working a little overtime.  Also, amazing food in the cafeteria!
cons: Only downside would be that there are a lot of Seasonal positions that come available at their busy time (Winter-Christmas season) but not everybody can get a full-time position after the busy season is over.

pros: Ability to assist refugees in need and the organization has a spirit of service. They are willing to go to where the greatest need is to lend support to needy individuals.
cons: Generally, there is dramatically different levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities on behalf of the international and domestic staff. In some cases, their experience exceeds the tasks in which they are assigned, in other cases, there are many ill equipped to handle the tasks assigned.

review_title: Great relief organization to gain some experience
pros: Getting programs started in relief contexts from external funding happened very quickly.  Resources are available to do what you need to do if you're in a hot relief setting.  Salary was pretty good and opportunities for internal transfers/promotions are okay if you're willing to relocate anywhere and live in any kind of living conditions
cons: Not a lot of support for long-term staff development or long-term development in programs, as the focus is definitely on relief programs.  Small enough that internal promotions and transfers can be difficult if you have restrictions (area of specialty, geographic preference, etc.)

review_title: incredible organization with awesome opportunities to share the gospel throughout the world being God's hands and feet.
pros: The ability to work with other committed Christians to share the Gospel around  the world reaching out to those who have never heard of Jesus.
cons: Challenging living conditions at times.  You must be prepared to live/work in very austere living environments from time to time or in some locations

pros: Staff and leadership have great hearts. Exponential growth always means change and sometimes that means that processes and systems can be behind but one thing is clear, this organization is about quality and excellence and caring for its staff.
cons: No glaring cons ... Are we not all in a process in the journey?  If you understand that we are all human and see on another by the "spirit" and see the heart of each person, then there are no cons.

review_title: Good job, good people, every workplace has a few cons (Field Position Review)
pros: Lots of responsibility. Constant change. Lots of opportunity to explore new places and introduce ideas. The work they do is good and needed.
cons: Heavy handed senior management. Poor IHQ to field communication. Field has little input into programming. Stingy with salaries and benefits. Poorly organized. Limited room for opinions that are not Southern and Christian.

pros: Start each day together as a group for devotions and prayer. Terrific healthcare. Extremely talented colleagues, many of who could be making more money in secular business, but choose to serve at Samaritan’s Purse along side other believers. For me, great sense that I am contributing to something more than what my role actually entails.
cons: Dress code is difficult for some to tolerate (ties for men especially) and employee turnover/satisfaction in some (but not most) departments seems high, but it may just be the nature and demands of the different types of work (field work vs HQ, etc.).

pros: Religious based organization that espouses the values of integrity and work ethics even as it serves in conflict areas with a lot of challenges
cons: Its salaries are not competitive hence unable to attract highly skilled individuals

pros: The organization tries to keep their focus on their mission statement. They emphasis their values through their programs. They try not to do what they do not have experience.
cons: The huge turn over often does not allow programs to meet their plans nor do the new staff take the time to learn why the program was developed the way it was. Reporting becomes the priority instead of meeting the needs.

pros: This ministry and organization have some of the most talented and gifted employees across all Departments that I have seen compared to the Private and Government Sectors. They provide great support for relocating families, including a great support network for wives and husbands.  The benefits are top notch, some of the best I have seen in my career.  Everything is done with excellence across all the departments, and the Global impact we have truly gives everyone a sense of the mission coming first of helping others in need and spreading the Gospel wherever we are.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Love the mission, and vision of the organization and the specific team I get to work with
job_title: Manager and Analyst in Boone, NC
pros: Committed staff with high christian character. The organization has incredible integrity.  Staff are passionate and equipped to serve. Culture of excellence, with  regular evaluation and improvement.  Very good benefits and positive work environment. My department's leadership is A++
cons: Finding qualified staff can be a challenge. The travel, weight of responsibility and impact on the ministry for the compensation offered can be a stumbling block.

review_title: Don't let the mission fool you.
pros: Physical Office environment is clean, well-stocked and beautifully decorated. Free coffee and kitchen break rooms are available. Senior managers get free cookies.
cons: Extremely legalistic and conservative culture is very intolerant of innovative thinking. Very low autonomy. Fear of negative press drives decision making. Overt sexism and rampant EEO violations. Job classifications and compensation is secret and discussing salaries is prohibited. ALL employees must clock in at exactly 8:00am; 1 min late requires a written explanation to the COO.

review_title: Conservative atmosphere making a worldwide impact.
pros: Great to be a part of a place making a worldwide impact.  Wide span of activities and projects and a very strong donor/financial base.
cons: Very conservative evangelical Christian atmosphere that may be interpreted as legalistic by some.  Growth seems at times to have outpaced infrastructure.

review_title: First class organization to work for!
pros: Samaritan's Purse is a great place to work.  First of all, everything is centered around serving others in the name of Jesus Christ.  Everyone is here for the same purpose, so there is alignment and teamwork across the entire organization.  The best part of working here is the people.  Integrity, character and genuine concern for others are the key qualities seen in leadership and among the teams.  The benefits are outstanding as well.
cons: I honestly can't think of any.

review_title: Once of a lifetime opportunity to learn about other cultures and make a difference
pros: Company Culture is about having boots on the ground first after a disaster or other event. They are very relational and family-oriented - and conscientious about meeting the needs of hurting people. Overall, they entrust a great deal of responsibility to their employees - and provide great working opportunities.
cons: They have gotten involved in disaster follow-ups at times without consulting other organizations. This kind of "ready, shoot, aim" approach rubs more traditional NGO's the wrong way.

pros: Great focus on helping others. Multiple opportunities to see how folks are helped inside and outside of the US. Organizational passion is amazing and fosters a staff buy in.
cons: Cult of personality towards CEO, as might be expected. C-Level inputs from uninformed or from those with no experience in the specific area hamper growth.

pros: Samaritan is a great company to work in and being christian one grows spiritually. The team is helpful and do what other people cant do. We work in challenging environment and the salary is not too bad.
cons: Most staff are family members, and those sent to work in various countries arent professional and as a result the make work very difficult as there is no ambition. Some pretend to be christian and preach water but take wine

review_title: Be Proactive and Willing to Learn
pros: Leadership is passionate about sharing the gospel and emphasizing that this is the real reason the development projects exist - to get your foot in the door to share the Gospel with beneficiaries.
cons: Health insurance for ex-pats in field is very cheap but has a high deductible ($1,000) and seems to only cover about 50% of medical expenses.

pros: Great work environment. Strong leaders who value your input and want to see you succeed. Structured environment that promotes teamwork and collaboration. Fun and rewarding work!
cons: The downside of this position was that it was only a seasonal position. Hourly pay and little benefits isn't ideal for everyone but worked well for a recent college grad.

review_title: I love being a part of an effort to help those in the toughest parts of the world, in Jesus name.  Hard to top that!
pros: This is a great organization that never waivers in its mission and purpose.  We aren't perfect, but we are a part of a ministry that is being used by God to reach people for Jesus.  People work hard and expect excellence.  The employees are some of the best in the field.
cons: The organization is growing and sometimes change is hard.

review_title: Seasonal Jobs vs Full time employment
pros: Being able to work a short amount of time for extra income at the end of the year. Hours are set, colored t-shirts dictate each department. Lots of support spiritually.
cons: Cannot even be a minute late, marks are placed against your name if you must take a day off (even for sickness). Not allowed to speak at all in some parts of the company.

pros: Reaching the lost and sharing the love of Jesus with them.
cons:
Open job positions inside the ministry are usually given to a friend of the manager or appointed by HR without doing proper job interviews. Normally the position is filled before they do interviews so it's a waist of everyone's time. 

Security is a joke. They focus on making the employees miserable and neglect the outside world.

pros: The work is very difficult and demanding but extremely rewarding- demonstrating in a tangible way the love and hope we have in Christ.
cons: Many of the positions require extended time away from home- travelling to remote, challenging or dangerous locations.  But employees are well-trained and prepared for this.

pros: Enjoyed offering aid and comfort around the world
cons: Very disorganized operation. The home office in Boone seemed to cause a lot of chaos when they would get involved in certain things. The HR department is a mess with too many young interns/new people making decisions.

pros: Mission driven organization that focuses on assisting the people that truly need help. Team members are united by this mission which creates a hard-working, motivating culture.
cons: Work-life balance, especially on the field, is almost non-existent. There is often a disconnect between IHQ staff and Field based staff which can be frustrating at times.

pros: Working at Samaritan's Purse provides opportunity for learning through doing. Employees are often given a lot of responsibilities in areas they may or may not be trained or experienced in. There is opportunity for advancement. Many great, motivated, and compassionate staff!
cons: Because people are often promoted quickly they often lack the necessary management skills to support subordinates.

review_title: Great if you plan to retire soon...
pros: If you are onboard with the mission, the philosophy and the President - you'll give the org 5 stars.
cons: If you consider your self progressive, open-minded or tolerant you will find the environment stifling. If you're looking to build a career - the exposure can be great, upward mobility is generally bad and if you move to Boone for a gig there's not much else. People frequently feel stuck and the mood/morale reflects this.

job_title: Assistant Director in North Wilkesboro, NC
pros: Samaritan's Purse partners with local churches, both in the U.S. and internationally. We understand that the local church was commissioned by Jesus to take the Gospel to all nations, in word and in action, and our mission is to mobilize and equip local churches to fulfill this calling effectively.
cons: As a disaster relief organization, you may be called on in times of crisis to help with the increased volume and needs related to a large-scale humanitarian response. Be prepared for those times and set your expectations accordingly.

pros: If you work here, you are a part of a strong mission and purpose.  They do a good job of connecting the day to day activities to the stories in the field.  There is very little turnover at headquarters, and the leadership has been there for 10+ years.
cons: Some longer term employees do not realize how good the environment is compared to other employers.  The grass is not greener.

review_title: An absolutely WONDERFUL company to work for!
pros:
Pay and benefits are great.
It's great to work with other like-minded believers. 
Everyone is so friendly.
Each day begins with encouragement, devotions, and prayer.
cons: The interview process can take a while. But I do appreciate that SP is so thorough in wanting to make sure they have true believers and people who genuinely want to work in the name of Christ.

pros:
Coworkers are hardworking and desire to be here.
The actual work we do abroad is top notch.
Good benefits
Gospel focuses
cons:
Family run and not much oversight of activity.
Some decisions made from leadership doesn't make sense because of lack of vision casting.
A good amount of work is created by friends of the family that run the organization or on personal projects.

pros: Being part of a lot of good works, living and helping many impacted by what is seen on the news.
cons: Developing potential to do even greater work tomorrow than what they are doing today.  Tremendous opportunities ahead for this humanitarian organization.

job_title: Media Relations Intern in Charlotte, NC
pros: Office culture very encouraging; didn't feel like a job, but more of a ministry.
cons: Too many seasonal jobs, impression tough to achieve full-time status in not in HQ city.

pros: When it comes to work environment, there is no better place to work. I have worked at a variety of secular jobs and there just is no comparison.  Everyone is polite, helpful, really just wants to be there to serve.
cons: Being a non-profit, pay rate tend to be a little lower, but are still somewhat competitive. Housing costs tend to be a little high.

pros: This organization does a lot of good work, think they should help out more in the US instead of going into other countries.
cons: People in management positions that are not qualified they have to have someone else do their work and they take the credit for it.

review_title: Lazy Samaritan Purse  Processing Center Managers  in Dallas Texas
pros: The volunteers and hourly employees enjoy serving Billy and Franklin Graham.
cons:
I quit Samaritan Purse after serving for a very short period of time. 

The SP staff were lazy.  Most of the SP managers walk around pretending as though they were busy. If fact, the volunteers and hourly employees were doing all the work.   This was not a "all hands on deck team work environment",  to me, this was a good example of Corporate America at its best.  
The hourly employees do all the work, while the SP managers get all the credit.

The SP staff did not assist the hourly employees in the processing center.
 Some areas were extremely short, the SP staff did not put down their clip boards to help.
 
The SP staff walked around with clip boards giving orders to the volunteers and hourly employees.  Amazingly, the volunteers and hourly hearts are in the right place, the SP ministry did not demonstrate  good work behavior and biblical leadership.  
Everyday, the  SP staff go through all the outward Christian duties, they pray before work shift, the Champlain gives a  pep rally quick sermon.  
Sadly, I saw SP managers that were well paid and top heavy without a servants heart.

The facility conditions were not suitable and safe for the elderly and children.
The restrooms were located outside.  Sometimes, you could not wash your hands, because the portable potty restrooms were being service.   
They had  hourly employees working outside in 31 degree temperature in pouring rain without adequate clothing to help keep them warm.  
The SP managers assigned employees for their work shifts when they arrive to work, the parking lot employees are not given an heads up to wear warm clothing and rain gear equipment the day before. So, the parking employees working for SP were placed in unhealthy working conditions.

If you nicely question anything, and I did, the HR and managers responded with angry and rudeness.

Franklin Graham should send in a undercover minister to secretly inspect the lazy warehouse managers.  

People of God, not all ministries are bad.  
Sadly,  in the body of Christ, there are dysfunctional ministries.
I  believe you should keep on serving and volunteering.  Find a ministry where the staff is leading by example.  
A place where they are walking the talk.  Don't give up on God's work. 

For me,  I will not be serving Samaritan Purse ever again, I will continue serving in other ways, e.g.,  missionary work in New Zealand, Fiji, China, Africa and America. 

Dallas, Texas

review_title: it was great initial project management experience
pros: working on specific project, international experience was added bonus, staff seemed have real desire to work with you and help out as needed. Morning time with staff was great!
cons: Travel on weekends, driving to airport in Charlotte to fly out, and working around international schedules.

review_title: Not family oriented and poorly managed
pros: Helping those in need, gospel oriented
cons: So much wasteful spending of donor money, No work/life balance, not family oriented at all, no vacation between November and January because people took Dec 26 off and Franklin said “You’ve had enough time with your family” at devotions, devotions is often watching Franklin doing interviews on FoxNews and has nothing to do with actual devotions to the Lord, lots of nepotism, unqualified people moved into management positions

pros: Samaritan's Purse is committed to the work of helping those in need around the world. The mission is woven through every department in the ministry and it is an honor to work here.
cons: Employees who have not worked in the corporate/industry environment and have only worked in ministry sometimes do not have a solid appreciation for how generous the organization is for a non-profit ministry.

pros: I loved my colleagues and the freedom I had to run programs in our field office in East Africa.
cons: Some of the politics at the HQ-level were frustrating. I did not always align with decisions that were made.

pros: Very mission focused with a highly committed work force.  It's a great place to live and work.  Boone, NC is a great place to live if you like the outdoors.
cons: Feels corporate in some ways, but I like that.  We strive to exceed the world's standards in all that we do, so the work is challenging but fun.

pros: Meaningful work with a Christ centered focus. Great people to work with and strong volunteer culture.
cons: In a small town. Very corporate, so jobs have structured perimeters that allow for little creativity or freedom. Can be difficult  to move around in organisation.

pros: Samaritan's Purse is an humanitarian and Christian organization that help the needed, and also teaches their staffs and support than  to advance their self to higher Education they wishes.
cons: Samaritan's Purse hit one who lies and one whom may not go by their mission statement

pros: Great mission, working in interesting places around the globe, lots of opportunity for career growth.
cons: Lip service to improving actual performance of the organization, discourage open communication and rely on military like leadership structure. Employ many folks who are quite frankly not that motivated.

review_title: Why you should work Samaritan's Purse
pros: Their core values, the working environment is good, emphasis on ethics and integrity
cons: It is one of the least paying NGOs in Uganda, and does not have a staff pensions scheme

review_title: The opportunity to work for this solid Christian Ministry.
job_title: Seasonal Team Leader in Charlotte, NC
pros: I believe in what they are trying to do to reach millions of children all over the world with special shoe boxes that people make and provide because of the love they have for these underprivileged children.
cons: I wasn't able to find any cons for this organization.

pros:
-Great feeling to serve people in crisis all over the world.
-Excellent benefits... they take good care of employees.
-Very positive work environment.
-Feel part of a family.
cons: -Fast growing organization with some growing pains that needs governance/policies/business practices to mature and be scalable.

pros: Amazing, meaningful work. Feel fulfilled knowing the work I do is really making a difference. Mission Statement is core of who Samaritan's Purse is, it's not a platitude, but it's really being accomplished.
cons: We are a disaster relief organization, which means we do work over holidays and work long hours at times.

pros: Ministry  of sharing the Gospel is truly happening on the field and the country offices seek to implement these components in every project where possible.
cons: Training is poor and joked internally to be a sink or swim environment  in order to see if you fit the mold the leadership is looking for or not.

pros:
We get to help the helpless in the name of Jesus.
We get to work with amazing volunteers from all over the country who are really just ordinary people but when we work together we tend to bond in a special way.
cons: Can't think of anything right now.

job_title: Biomedical Equipment Technician in North Wilkesboro, NC
pros: This is so much more than a job or even a career, working for SP is an opportunity to be part of a ministry. Within the first six months I feel as if I have established a whole new family and really feel like part of the mission.
cons: I have not experienced any.

pros: Purpose in my job. I get to use my experience now to help others! Smaller team with excellent friendships.
cons: Long hours but worth it. It took some time to acclimate to BOONE but my family is now adjusted and thriving.

pros: I got to help homeowners get back on their feet by rebuilding, mud-outs.
cons: There are no cons to speak about this organization

pros: I like the way you motivate your staff as well their welfare.
cons: Indigenous peoples does not respect refuge right and refuges do escaping from the camp without authority notice.

pros: Travel opportunities arise from time to time.
cons: Professional Qqualifications are not recognised. It's more of who recommends you. So the longer you work the higher the chances of getting that dream job promotion. This is a family business. I wouldn't recommend anyone ambitious to join Samaritan's purse

pros: The organization runs like a family, and it is not difficult to get to know people across the company.
cons: With the family atmosphere, there are pitfalls that the organization falls into. Many decisions seem to have an emotional rational.

pros: Small enough ngo to be flexible and make an immediate difference. Strongly committed to long-term projects.
cons: Fast-paced environment is better for young singles than families.

pros:
Work/life balance
Amazing teammates who encourage, support and collaborate
Personal and professional growth and development
Compelling and meaningful mission - fulfillment in work - work is output of core identity and passion of spreading the gospel of Jesus Christ.
cons: Would love to see more diversity.

job_title: Ministry Project Officer in Juba, Baḩr al Jabal
pros: I work for Samaritan Purse because it is Christian organization
cons: It is always good to work for Samaritan's Purse and like any other Christian Organizations because of faith growth and career development

review_title: Career with a cause/Cutting edge Dev Shop
job_title: Senior Applications Developer/Team Lead in Boone, NC
pros: Freedom to build solutions using the best tools and technologies for the business need. Great benefits, flexible environment, abundant resources.
cons: Typical red tape and legalism that comes with working for a nonprofit ministry.

review_title: Fast growing organization with some growing pains
pros: great people and competitive salary and benefits
cons: Poor information management and not the most technically proficient organization

job_title: User Experience/User Interface Designer in Woodbridge, VA
pros:
- Given more responsibility than typical internships, but also enough grace to go along with it.
- Everyone has a passion for what they are doing.
cons: - Can be a fast paced environment at times.

pros: Friendly work culture, great on-campus facilities, beautiful location. People are genuinely passionate about the mission of the organization.
cons: Very religious and conservative. Hours rigid and inflexible, dress code archaic.

pros: Christian Atmosphere, Daily Devotions, Family oriented and they understand the importance of family time and values.
cons: Driving in the Ice and Snow in the mountains but I'm from Florida.

pros: Awesome company to work for. They do everything so well. Well planned out.
cons: There are no cons in this organization. I have been impressed with everything they have done. They do everything to Honor God.

review_title: Work as a team to bring relief to disasters, health crisis, and systemic poverty in response to your faith
pros: Well qualified team mates, fair compensation, sufficient resources to get the job done, high standards
cons: Excessive internal politics, dense layer of middle management, high turnover of management

pros: My top reason to work at the OCC processing center was the people I got to work with, volunteers and staff. It was some of the most rewarding work I’ve ever been a part of.
cons: Hours were long, short term work. Heavy workload.

review_title: Generally,  Samaritan's Purse is a good organization
job_title: Program Manager in Juba, Baḩr al Jabal
pros:
- They keep their values 
- Benefits are good 
- You will have the opportunity to share the gospel
cons:
- In some cases, employees are not empowered
- Some decisions are not transparent

pros: Boldly proclaims the Gospel. Passionate about the work. Devotions to start every work day. 401K . Big mission and vision. Unique opportunities.
cons: Lagging behind in staff care and organizational professionalism

pros: This company has a very well-organized system and everyone is genuinely caring and loving towards one another. Working here was a huge blessing and an unforgettable experience.
cons: I couldn't find any cons while working at Samaritan's Purse

pros: Great faith based environment. Really awesome coworkers. Lots of opportunities for growth and promotion
cons: Good wage for non-profit but still not great salary

review_title: Helpful GOD Willing Lots of Faithful Followers.
pros: Help others  Spread the words of the LORD  Lots of SMILES from others!
cons: The work was not always deliver on TIME!

pros:
